tutorials.title: ESP32 I2S Audio: Sine Wave Generator
Building Your First MIDI Controller
tutorials.content:
# Building Your First MIDI Controller

Learn how to turn potentiometers and buttons into a USB MIDI device.

## Components
- ESP32
- 10k Potentiometers
- Buttons

## Wiring
- Pot Center -> GPIO 34
- Pot Left -> GND
- Pot Right -> 3.3V
- Button -> GPIO 14 & GND (Internal Pullup)

tutorials.title: Audio Synthesis on Daisy Seed
ESP32 I2S Audio: Sine & Sequencer
tutorials.content:
# ESP32 I2S Audio

Using MAX98357A or PCM5102 DACs.

## Wiring
- BCLK: GPIO 26
- LRCK: GPIO 25
- DIN: GPIO 22

artists.name: Rosa Menkman
artists.bio: Dutch glitch artist + theorist exploring image compression, noise, and resolution politics.

artists.name: Nick Briz
artists.bio: Artist/educator hacking codecs, YouTube infrastructures, and digital rights.

artists.name: Jon Satrom
artists.bio: System-based glitch performer working with OS failures and software improvisation.

artists.name: Karl Klomp
artists.bio: Hardware hacker creating analog video glitch devices and ‘dirty mixers’.

artists.name: Gijs Gieskes
artists.bio: Artist/maker designing small glitchy electronic instruments and video benders.

artists.name: Takeshi Murata
artists.bio: Visual artist known for pioneering datamosh aesthetics in early digital video art.

artists.name: Ryoji Ikeda
artists.bio: Japanese minimal sound/data artist working with ultrasonics, math, and high-contrast visuals.

artists.name: JODI (jodi.org)
artists.bio: Duo of early net artists breaking interfaces, games, and websites as material.

artists.name: Vuk Ćosić
artists.bio: Early net artist working with ASCII, early web, and media archaeology.

artists.name: Olia Lialina
artists.bio: Net art pioneer making early-web style narrative pages and theory.

artists.name: Cory Arcangel
artists.bio: Artist hacking games, obsolete tech, and pop culture (Super Mario clouds, etc.).

artists.name: Kim Asendorf
artists.bio: Artist working with pixel sorting, generative GIFs, and data aesthetics.

artists.name: Rafael Rozendaal
artists.bio: Artist making websites as artworks, simple interactive abstractions.

artists.name: Casey Reas
artists.bio: Co-creator of Processing, generative and software-based visual artist.

artists.name: Zach Lieberman
artists.bio: Artist focusing on expressive computational drawing and openFrameworks.

artists.name: Merzbow (Masami Akita)
artists.bio: Pioneer of Japanese noise; extreme electronics, feedback, and sonic density.

artists.name: La Monte Young
artists.bio: Minimalist composer exploring tuning systems, drones, and long-duration music.

artists.name: Alvin Lucier
artists.bio: Composer examining acoustics, perception, and resonance.

artists.name: Pauline Oliveros
artists.bio: Composer and creator of Deep Listening; focus on body, attention, and sonic awareness.

artists.name: Eliane Radigue
artists.bio: Composer of long, evolving analog drone works using ARP 2500 and later acoustic players.

artists.name: Holly Herndon
artists.bio: Musician using AI, voice processing, and networked collaboration.

artists.name: Pan Sonic
artists.bio: Finnish duo known for minimal, brutal electronics built from self-designed devices.

artists.name: Nurse With Wound
artists.bio: Long-running experimental/industrial collage project by Steven Stapleton.

artists.name: Wolf Eyes
artists.bio: American noise group mixing tape collage, junk metal, and electronics.

artists.name: Fennesz
artists.bio: Austrian guitarist using granular digital processing to blur noise and melody.

artists.name: Tim Hecker
artists.bio: Canadian musician working with dense, distorted ambient and noise.

artists.name: Ben Frost
artists.bio: Composer using heavy dynamics, distortion, and post-minimalist repetition.

artists.name: Ikue Mori
artists.bio: Improviser and composer using drum machines and laptop electronics.

artists.name: Oval (Markus Popp)
artists.bio: Early ‘glitch music’ project using CD skipping and digital artifacts as structure.

artists.name: Oneohtrix Point Never (Daniel Lopatin)
artists.bio: Experimental electronic musician using samples, synths, and meta-pop structures.

artists.name: The Caretaker (Leyland Kirby)
artists.bio: Project exploring memory, decay, and hauntology through treated ballroom music.

artists.name: Janet Cardiff
artists.bio: Sound artist known for audio walks and layered narrative headphone pieces.

artists.name: Christina Kubisch
artists.bio: Sound artist revealing hidden electromagnetic fields via custom headphones.

artists.name: Max Neuhaus
artists.bio: Early sound artist making permanent and site-specific sound installations.

artists.name: Susan Philipsz
artists.bio: Artist using voice and song in public spaces as sculptural sound.

artists.name: Marina Abramović
artists.bio: Performance art icon exploring endurance, vulnerability, and ritual.

artists.name: Stelarc
artists.bio: Australian artist integrating robotics + prosthetics + tech into the body (third ear, suspensions).

artists.name: Chris Burden
artists.bio: Early performance artist exploring danger, violence, and systems.

artists.name: Rebecca Horn
artists.bio: Sculptor/performance artist extending the body with machines, feathers, prosthetics.

artists.name: Tehching Hsieh
artists.bio: Performance artist known for year-long endurance works testing time, labor, and life.

artists.name: Carolee Schneemann
artists.bio: Performance and film artist focusing on body, sexuality, and feminist critique.

artists.name: Ana Mendieta
artists.bio: Cuban-American artist using her body in landscape, ritual, and earth works.

artists.name: Orlan
artists.bio: French artist using plastic surgery and medical procedures as performance.

artists.name: Ron Athey
artists.bio: Performance artist working with blood, ritual, and queer body politics.

artists.name: Franko B
artists.bio: Performance artist using bleeding, endurance, and vulnerability as language.

artists.name: Guillermo Gómez-Peña
artists.bio: Performance/poetry artist exploring border politics, identity, and hybridity.

artists.name: Nam June Paik
artists.bio: Father of video art; TV sculptures, satellites, interactivity.

artists.name: Bill Viola
artists.bio: Slow-motion spiritual video environments with strong art-historical grounding.

artists.name: Laurie Anderson
artists.bio: Multimedia artist merging performance, storytelling, electronics, and instruments.

artists.name: Golan Levin
artists.bio: Artist-engineer making interactive systems and audiovisual tools.

artists.name: Hito Steyerl
artists.bio: Artist/filmmaker analyzing digital images, surveillance, and geopolitics.

artists.name: James Turrell
artists.bio: Light + perception artist shaping architecture with pure color.

artists.name: Rafael Lozano-Hemmer
artists.bio: Artist creating large-scale interactive installations using light, sensors, and public space.

artists.name: Random International
artists.bio: Studio known for interactive installations like Rain Room.

artists.name: teamLab
artists.bio: Japanese collective making immersive digital projection environments.

artists.name: Monika Fleischmann & Wolfgang Strauss
artists.bio: Early media art duo working on interactive virtual realities and interfaces.

artists.name: David Rokeby
artists.bio: Media artist working with interactive sound/video and surveillance systems.

artists.name: Heather Dewey-Hagborg
artists.bio: Artist working with DNA, biometrics, and speculative forensic portraits.

artists.name: Ryoichi Kurokawa
artists.bio: Audiovisual artist combining precise digital visuals with abstract sound.

artists.name: Hans Haacke
artists.bio: Conceptual artist exposing political and economic structures in art institutions.

artists.name: Barbara Kruger
artists.bio: Artist using bold text-image compositions to critique power and ideology.

artists.name: Jenny Holzer
artists.bio: Artist known for text-based public works (LEDs, projections, benches).

artists.name: Yinka Shonibare CBE
artists.bio: Artist using Dutch wax fabrics to talk about colonialism and identity.

artists.name: Santiago Sierra
artists.bio: Conceptual artist staging exploitative or uncomfortable situations to reveal power.

artists.name: Guerrilla Girls
artists.bio: Anonymous feminist collective using posters and interventions to critique art world sexism and racism.

artists.name: Reed Ghazala
artists.bio: Father of circuit bending; turning cheap electronics into expressive instruments.

artists.name: Eric Archer
artists.bio: Designer of analog noise devices, drum machines, and synth circuits.

artists.name: Meng Qi
artists.bio: Synth designer blending organic interfaces with experimental electronics (Wing Pinger, etc.).

artists.name: Ciat-Lonbarde (Peter Blasser)
artists.bio: Maker of wooden, touch-based, chaotic analog instruments.

artists.name: Martin Howse
artists.bio: Artist exploring earth signals, electromagnetism, and psychogeophysics.

artists.name: Tristan Perich
artists.bio: Composer using 1-bit electronics and minimal systems in both sound and visual work.

artists.name: Yuri Suzuki
artists.bio: Sound artist/designer creating playful audio devices and installations.

artists.name: Sam Battle (Look Mum No Computer)
artists.bio: YouTube maker building insane modular synths, Furby organs, and DIY machines.

artists.name: Tom Bugs (BugBrand)
artists.bio: Builder of compact modular and standalone analog synths and processors.

artists.name: Bastl Instruments
artists.bio: Czech collective/company making small modular/desktop synths with DIY spirit.

artists.name: Nonlinearcircuits (Andrew Fitch)
artists.bio: Designer of chaotic, experimental Eurorack modules and PCBs for DIY.

artists.name: Death By Audio (Oliver Ackermann)
artists.bio: Noise rock musician and pedal designer (insanely loud/experimental stompboxes).

artists.name: Teenage Engineering
artists.bio: Swedish company making quirky, design-focused instruments and pocket operators.

artists.name: Peter Zinovieff
artists.bio: Composer and engineer behind EMS synths (VCS3, Synthi), early computer music.

artists.name: Leos Carax
artists.bio: French filmmaker blending surrealism, music, and dream logic (Holy Motors).

artists.name: David Lynch
artists.bio: Filmmaker creating atmospheric, symbolic, sound-driven surreal worlds.

artists.name: Shinya Tsukamoto
artists.bio: Japanese director exploring body-machine violence (Tetsuo).

artists.name: Harmony Korine
artists.bio: American filmmaker exploring glitchy Americana, chaos, and subculture.

artists.name: Apichatpong Weerasethakul
artists.bio: Thai filmmaker using slow cinema, dreams, and layered realities.

artists.name: Gaspar Noé
artists.bio: Director exploring extreme sensation, chaos, and experimental structure.

artists.name: Terry Gilliam
artists.bio: Director with dense, handmade dystopian worlds (Brazil, etc.).

artists.name: Michal Rovner
artists.bio: Artist working with video loops of human figures and abstraction.

artists.name: Sigalit Landau
artists.bio: Installation/video artist often using the Dead Sea, salt, and the body.

artists.name: Guy Ben-Ner
artists.bio: Video artist using low-budget domestic setups and humor.

artists.name: Ohad Fishof
artists.bio: Artist working with sound, performance, and hybrid media.

artists.name: Adi Gelbart
artists.bio: Musician/artist combining analog electronics, animation, and absurd narratives.

artists.name: Daniel Landau
artists.bio: Artist working with VR, performance, and embodied media.
